p: Investigations carried out on I. dewevrei leaf essential oil, using a combination of chromatographic (CC, GC(RI)) and spectroscopic techniques (GC-MS, 13C-NMR), led to the identification of fifty-seven constituents accounting for 95.51 and 97.1% of the whole oil samples’ compositions. The two samples were characterized by a similar chemical composition dominated by germacrene D (23.6 and 20.5%, respectively), followed by germacrene d-8-one (8.9 and 8.7%), (10βH)-1β,8β-epoxy-cadina-4-ene ( 38) (7.3 and 8.7%), (7αH)-germacrene d-8β-ol ( 52) (7.8 and 7.4%) and cadina-1(10),4-dien-8β-ol ( 56) (7.6 and 7.2%). Compounds 38, 52 as well as (7αH)-germacrene D-8α-ol 53 are new natural sesquiterpenes, isolated from sample S2 and fully characterized by QTOF-MS, 1D and 2D-NMR. In addition, cadina-1(10),4-dien-8β-ol ( 56) was also isolated from this oil sample and its NMR data are reported for the first time.
